summary: The 'Billionaires Income Tax Act' proposes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to eliminate tax loopholes that allow high-income individuals to defer taxes indefinitely. It aims to require billionaires to pay taxes annually, modify over 30 tax provisions, and close loopholes related to strategies like 'buy, borrow, die.' The bill covers various aspects, including eliminating tax deferral, defining 'applicable taxpayers,' and modifying rules for applicable entities, trusts, deferred compensation, and certain investments.
